data.what_is:
Actito is a SaaS marketing automation company founded in 2000.  Back then, the three founders wanted to bridge the gap between brands and consumers. So they started building the software that marketers now love. With Actito, you can personalize your interactions by the second, with hundreds, thousands, even millions of customers worldwide. 

Actito targets mid to large companies who want to run all their marketing activities from one easy-to-use platform.

All the customer data you are collecting is centralized and consolidated onto a Customer Data Platform and made available to tailor, target and personalize right-time messages through main marketing channels - namely email, mobile and web. 

Actito offers full compliance with Europe's latest general data protection regulations (GDPR), leaving marketers free to focus on building lasting and profitable customer relationships. 

Actito runs its European operations from its headquarters in Belgium, and also has offices in France and The Netherlands. Actito is also present in North America with an office in Canada. More than 250 clients use the platform worldwide including ABB, Friesland Campina, Biocodex, ARTE, WWF and KIA.

all_reviews.review_content:

I strongly believe the most powerful tool Actito has to offer is its targeting tool (which is part of their profile management section). I have had the opportunity to use other CRMs and from a targeting tool point of view, Actito's is by far the most advanced, reliable and easy one. As a user I can really appreciate the efforts being put into making it so valuable in order for marketeers to leverage data to their advantage.

What do you dislike about Actito?
Something I would improve in terms of targets being created would be the ability to organise the segments into folders. As such, it makes it easier to navigate through all the type of segments you create. Currently, you've got a list that you can browse, but unless you know what you're looking for, there's no way to actually visualise all the targets that have been created in a user-friendly way.

One thing I absolutely dislike (heavily), is the fact that email creation binds us into using blocks, without ANY flexibility. In other words: you do not have access to HTML directly in the editor when using a pre-configured template. I know competitors who offer that option (and limit it to actual "custom HTML blocks" that you can insert) and being in 2021, it baffles me that this isn't available on Actito. Understandably they have their business model and not all their clients are at ease with HTML, but with all-around digital marketeers, that have generally speaking a decent understanding of HTML being able to leverage some level of HTML to make simple things happen would make such a big difference. Right now, if I want that, I need to build something from scratch or use a template, export it and work in the export to import it again later one... but I would loose anything related to "customization" bound to what I initially worked on.

It would mean so much to me if they can adjust this. It's soon 2022 guys, level up.

What problems is Actito solving and how is that benefiting you?
Actito just allows me to do my job the right way. It's silly to say it like that but from a software point of view it allows to do so much (including webforms etc..) and with the integrations of third party tools it makes it fun to drive digital marketing campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: The most adaptable CRM Automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Actito?
Actito is flexible as you wish. You can do lot of things.

The UX is very simple and effective. Sending a campaign or creating a complex scenario takes a few minutes. The full process to create a campaign is very short and it works well.

The data model is very powerful (relational model) and very simple to create and maintain.
The audience targeting tool is quite fantastic. Simple to use and fast to calculate. You can play with many OR and AND blocks, on different types of data: Users' Profile Information, LookUp Data Table, Actions table or Email behaviors. You can combine several dynamic targets and/or several segments already calculated.

The scenario system is well done and complete. Drag and drop triggers, emails...
Good to know, when you create your data model, you can set up some triggers to start any scenario (e.g. new purchase, new rating, updated order ...)

APIs and webhooks are useful and can save a lot of time to integrate your CRM to your website/database without complex architecture.
We also use it to manage some automated campaigns and transactional emails (as forgotten password).

The documentation is available for each user and understandable.

Finally, the main satisfaction is the Actito Team (customer success manager, sales or project manager are amazing). They are always ready to help us to find quickly as possible any solution (and always with the smile). The tool and its features are constantly improved.

What do you dislike about Actito?
It is not easy to export automatically or expose data to another service as Facebook for example. It's very frustrating when you want to reach your prospects with something else than email or SMS.

Default dashboards are not complete but with some tricks we can get a lot of data and analysis. They are enough to follow your main KPIs but they should more detailed.

The last point is the templating system. It exists, but it is not the best fature. It is also impossible to import data from API (as JSON or XML) directly to your email (in a scenario for example).

Recommendations to others considering Actito:
Go for it. It is a really good tool.

What problems is Actito solving and how is that benefiting you?
Flexibility. Before Actito it was always hard to change something, to improve our data model, to create a specific email journey. Today we are agile.
